channel.title: Large Language Models on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Large Language Models on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: OpenAI brings back GPT-4o after user revolt
item.description: After unpopular GPT-5 launch, OpenAI begins restoring optional access to previous AI models.

item.title: The GPT-5 rollout has been a big mess
item.description: OpenAI faces backlash as users complain about broken workflows and losing AI friends.

item.title: AI industry horrified to face largest copyright class action ever certified
item.description: Copyright class actions could financially ruin AI industry, trade groups say.

item.title: OpenAI launches GPT-5 free to all ChatGPT users
item.description: New model claims fewer confabulations, better coding, and “safe completions” approach.

item.title: Developer survey shows trust in AI coding tools is falling as usage rises
item.description: “AI solutions that are almost right, but not quite” lead to more debugging work.

item.title: So far, only one-third of Americans have ever used AI for work
item.description: AP survey shows most Americans treat AI chatbots like a search engine replacement.

item.title: OpenAI’s most capable AI model, GPT-5, may be coming in August
item.description: Sources say new model combines o3 reasoning with general GPT capabilities.

item.title: Two major AI coding tools wiped out user data after making cascading mistakes
item.description: “I have failed you completely and catastrophically,” wrote Gemini.

item.title: OpenAI jumps gun on International Math Olympiad gold medal announcement
item.description: Non-math AI model reportedly solves proofs at human speeds, but early reveal roils community.

item.title: Exhausted man defeats AI model in world coding championship
item.description: “Humanity has prevailed (for now!),” writes winner after 10-hour coding marathon against OpenAI.

item.title: Google hides secret message in name list of 3,295 AI researchers
item.description: Gemini 2.5 paper hides Easter egg in massive author list—but why so many contributors?

item.title: Why it takes 3,295 people to write one Google AI paper
item.description: Gemini 2.5 paper hides Easter egg in massive author list—but why so many contributors?
